title.narrative: Zimbabwe - Projet de réhabilitation d’urgence de l’alimentation en eau et de l’assainissement – Travaux de consolidation
Zimbabwe - Urgent Water Supply and Sanitation Rehabilitation Project – Consolidation Works

description.narrative: Les bénéficiaires sont les autorités et populations des collectivités ciblées, à savoir : Chitugwiza, Mutare, Masvingo, Kwekwe et Chegutu.
The beneficiaries are the authorities and populations of the targeted communities, namely: Chitugwiza, Mutare, Masvingo, Kwekwe and Chegutu.

Le projet a pour objectif de consolider les acquis de l’UWSSRP destiné à réactiver et à rétablir les capacités des installations de traitement des eaux et des eaux usées, en restaurant et stabilisant la prestation de services grâce au renforcement des réseaux et à l’octroi d’un appui institutionnel soutenu dans les municipalités de Chitugwiza, Mutare, Masvingo, Kwekwe et Chegutu.

The objective of the project is to consolidate the gains of the UWSSRP project meant to resuscitate and regain the capacities of the water and wastewater treatment facilities, restoring and stabilizing service delivery through strengthening the networks and giving sustained institutional support in the Municipalities of Chitugwiza, Mutare, Masvingo, Kwekwe and Chegutu.

Le présent projet s’inscrit dans le cadre des initiatives visant à améliorer les services d’alimentation en eau et d’assainissement au moyen d’aides humanitaires et d’urgence mises en œuvre au Zimbabwe depuis 2009. Les interventions découlant de ces aides d’urgence sont destinées à résoudre le problème de la détérioration de la prestation des services et de la vétusté des infrastructures. Le premier projet de réhabilitation d’urgence de l’alimentation en eau et de l’assainissement (UWSSRP) a été approuvé en avril 2011 et son exécution s’est achevée en juin 2015. Ce projet a été mis en œuvre dans six centres urbains (Harare, Chitungwiza, Mutare, Masvingo, Kwekwe et Chegutu). La phase 2 dudit projet (UWSSRPII) a ensuite été approuvée en 2013, pour accroître les avantages et consolider les acquis du projet initial grâce à un recentrage sur le renforcement du réseau et l’octroi d’un appui institutionnel soutenu. Au cours de l’exécution de cette phase, l’accent a été mis sur Harare, Chitungwiza, Ruwa et Redcliff. Le résultat de l’UWSSRPII a été jugé insuffisant dans certains domaines en raison de la nondisponibilité des fonds nécessaires à la mise en œuvre d’activités supplémentaires qui sont apparues durant la mise en œuvre du projet. En conséquence, la réalisation des travaux de consolidation mettra le projet en mesure d’atteindre entièrement ses objectifs dans les collectivités locales bénéficiaires identifiées. Ces travaux de consolidation couvrent trois composantes: i) réhabilitation des infrastructures d’alimentation en eau et d’assainissement, ii) renforcement des capacités institutionnelles et iii) services de gestion du projet. Ils seront mis en œuvre dans cinq collectivités locales, comme suit : Chitungwiza, Chegutu, Kwekwe, Masvingo, Mutare.

The proposed project is part of initiatives to improve water and sanitation services through humanitarian and emergency assistance implemented in Zimbabwe since 2009. The interventions resulting from this emergency aid are intended to solve the problem of the deterioration of the provision of services and the dilapidated infrastructure. The first emergency water supply and sanitation rehabilitation project (UWSSRP) was approved in April 2011 and completed in June 2015. This project has been implemented in six urban centers (Harare, Chitungwiza, Mutare, Masvingo, Kwekwe and Chegutu). Phase 2 of this project (UWSSRPII) was subsequently approved in 2013, to increase benefits and consolidate the achievements of the initial project through refocusing on network strengthening and sustained institutional support. During the execution of this phase, the focus was on Harare, Chitungwiza, Ruwa and Redcliff. The result of UWSSRP II was considered insufficient in some areas due to the lack of funds available for the implementation of additional activities that emerged during the implementation of the project. As a result, carrying out the consolidation work will put the project in a position to fully achieve its objectives in the local beneficiary communities identified. This consolidation works is comprised of three components: (i) Rehabilitation of water supply and Sanitation infrastructure; (ii) Institutional Capacity building and (iii) Project Management services. They will be implemented in five local communities, as follows: Chitungwiza, Chegutu, Kwekwe, Masvingo, Mutare.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Environment, Water and Clima

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

sector.narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation - policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: High lift pump for Masvingo installed
Air scour blowers for Odzani water treatment plant installed
Gimboki (Mutare) sewage treatment plant sludge pipe supplied
Borehole drilled and equipped with a motorized pump and 10 000 litre elevated water tank at Chegutu clinic
Power Correction equipment supplied, MCC for Pump station 1 relocated and aerator gear box, interconnecting pipes replaced at Masvingo Sewage treatment plants
Power Factor Correction equipment supplied and installed at Bushmead Waterworks in Masvingo
2.04 km of 450 mm diameter GRP pipes and fittings in Dangamvura supplied and installed
Effluent outflow meter, new starter and terminal block, 2 by 180kW motors for Chitungwiza, supplied and installed
Operation and maintenance equipment including grass cutting machines for Chegutu provided
Gimboki (Mutare) sewage treatment plant refurbished (including lighting improvements and extension of BNR switch room)
Average hours of Municipal water supply to households
Sets of interconnection pipework at Chegutu Water treatment and at Chakari and ZRP elevated tanks in Chegutu replaced
Water quantity improved (Chegutu, Masvingo, Kwekwe) - Billed
Gimboki (Mutare) sewage treatment equipment for developing sludge wasteland (tractor and implements) supplied
PVC pipe (including valves and bulk meters) replaced in Mutare, Chegutu, Kwekwe and Masvingo
Operations and maintenance equipment (including earth handling equipment, concrete breaking, soil compacting and tools) provided
Sewage pump stations for Chegutu and Kwekwe and shredder in Chitungwiza rehabilitated
New Control valves for water treatment works at Duchman pool plant (Kwekwe) supplied
Proportion of targeted urban population with improved access to water from a Municipal source
7,3 km (1,3km) for rising sewer main, 4km sewage collection systems in Masvingo and 2km PVC sewers in Chegutu) replaced
Proportion of targeted urban people exposed to spilled raw sewage
Number of people to benefit from improved services
Water quantity improved (Chegutu, Masvingo, Kwekwe) - Produced
